item.title: Deconstructing SPF with Rust using Generics
item.description: As I mentioned in my previous article Deconstructing SPF Records with Rust. There is a case for using generics given the amount of overlap between the different mechanisms. So in this article I will document how I transitioned from using unique structs for each mechanism, leading to less overall code and other benefits. While I was considering how best to go about doing generics, I came across this very nice write up on dev.

item.title: Deconstructing SPF Records with Rust
item.description: Hi. If you have visited my blog before you might have seen my series on using the trust-dns-resolver crate. As part of that series I looked at querying DNS TXT records. During the process I was reminded of SPF records. Something I used to deal with in a previous position. And this got me to thinking about using SPF records as a way to learn more about working with rust.

item.title: MX and Host lookup using the trust-dns-resolver Crate
item.description: I used to often work with DNS in one of my previous jobs. So I have always had a long running interesting in DNS. Most recently I have been looking into Rust. I wanted to see how easy it might be to use rust to access DNS records, one; because rust is said to be fast, and also because it’s a safe programming language. This will be a brief write up at my attempt to use trust-dns-resolver to do MX record lookups and subsequently host address lookups.
